org.zelvator.dragImage

Class ImagePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.zelvator.dragImage.ImagePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class ImagePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    ImagePanel is a class, which extends JPanel and let draw images in it.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImagePanel

        public ImagePanel(java.lang.String path,
          boolean answerImage)
        Constructor for ImagePanel
        Parameters:
        path - is set, if the path of picture is known, e.g. if it is loaded from xml file, or Drag and Drop action is performed.
        answerImage - false if it is drawn into classic container, true if it is drawn in JList.

      • ImagePanel

        public ImagePanel()
        Constructor for ImagePanel. If no picture is known, or there is error in loading files, empty image will be painted.

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        protected void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method overrides paintComponent of JPanel. Gets image's size, compare to window, if it's bigger than component which is drawn within, it will be scaled by the getScaledImage method, centered it and rendered. Else it will be just centered and rendered.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • getScaledImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getScaledImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                          int width,
                                          int height)
                                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Method takes BufferedImage and desired max width and height and scale it using AffineTransform
        Parameters:
        image -
        width -
        height -
        Returns:
        BufferedImage
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Method used for being rendered. If anwerImage is true, meant as if it is rendered in JList as answer's image, scale it to 200x150, else just return image.
        Returns:
        BufferedImage
